subject: Re: [junit] How to get a stack trace with junit.textui.TestRunner
msgSnippet: One possibility would be to add a TestListener to your TestResult object. This listener could then exit the stack trace when its addError(Test,Throwable)
messageBody:
One possibility would be to add a TestListener to your TestResult
object. This listener could then exit the stack trace when its
addError(Test,Throwable) method is invoked. Using a test listener
requires to use Test.run(TestResult) instead of just Test.run().

Johannes
